text: An unmitigated disaster with an over reactive Garfield, a distant Roberts, and a mystifying plot. One wishes for clarity which never comes. Such a waste of talent, but I suppose even A-list actors have to keep churning. A big waste of movie making with no magic.

I liked it overall. It was very slow and hard to get into. The music and the metronome are awful at times. It is so dark & often blurry- it's hard to see what is happening and it causes eye strain.  I watched it for free on Amazon. At times it felt a bit contrived and confusing but the acting was great and it portrayed the current insanity of academia very well imo. Some parts felt manipulative such as not explaining exactly what the facts were. So many are terrified to speak out about the current state of affairs.

 Julia Roberts looked terrible which I assume was due to being very ill with improperly treated ulcers. I was suspicious of the student who was snooping in her professor's house the day after she was accused of plagiarism. It seemed like she planned the whole event however this was never confirmed. There were zero consequences for the plagiarism and she smeared everyone. It's scary to see the caliber of all who are running and attending the elite schools as portrayed in this film. 

4 not believable manipulations: Student snoops and accuses both professors after plagiarizing is confronted but we're expected to trust her, professor is implied to attack JR also so he must have attacked student, JR steals rx- she would have gone to her husband or doctor for rx and treatment, JR becomes dean after all of it, maybe but probably not. 

The accused professor is never heard from again until JR and student meet up 5 years later, he became a political consultant making big bucks- he would've sued probably at the time though. The moral of the story is have cameras in your home everywhere and never socialize with or  be alone with anyone at your employment.
Terrible. Just terrible.

What an enormous disappointment.  To have such a talented list of actors and still fall so flat is probably the only impressive thing about this movie.  From the awkward music that is fighting for your attention to the constant feeling that you inadvertently missed a few chapters, the whole thing was giving Lifetime movie network at 3am.

I kept waiting for the plot to kick in and move along and leave the boring elites and their high brow conversations in the next county. It never happens. I gave it nearly 40 minutes of my time and then moved on. Sad for the talent in the cast.

Las actuaciones son solventes , la historia por momentos atrapa y por otros se disuelve .Pero lo INTOLERABLE es la música que tapa los diálogos , horrenda y una fotografía digna de un principiante  , mal iluminada en la mayoría de las escenas, oscura, demasiadas sombras , no ves gestos , caras y sumado que los diálogos son tapados por la música , la hacen padecerla . Una pena

She's a professor...but the subject is a bit off putting.  I randomly clicked on this movie and didn't know . it does make me wonder what director Luca"s other films are like.tbe acting was good but Should you watch it ? its not for the faint of heart . you might watch it anyway if you are a Julia fan .The ending is confusing . it seems they both won ...but at the same time am left feeling confused.
Waaaayyyyy too slow. Couldn't get through it. Had to give up a half hour in.

Boring and self-indulgent. 

A movie about an interesting topic, and yet one with nothing to say.
Disappointing movie for Julia Roberts. I expected more.  It was boring and annoying with the stopwatch sounds.  Don't waste your time on this one.

This movie was so bad I felt compelled to write my first Rotten Tomato Review. It was awful. Slow, weird, sad. Watch this if you like feeling uncomfortable and then at the end - SURPRISE - it's a movie about women who cry wolf. So BIG FU to this HORRIBLE movie. Don't waste your time.

Very muddled and disjointed with a disappointing ending. Some scenes were reminiscent of Eraserhead and the constant dark lighting throughout the film made it bleak to watch. I congratulate myself in enduring the film to the end, unlike my wife.

Pretentious nonsense. Seems like just a vehicle for Julia Roberts to showcase some acting. Pointless and unfulfilling storyline, issues not examined in any meaningful way. Total non-ending.
One of the worst and dullest films I've ever watched.
Pretentious and boring.

Pretentious namedropping, cliche-riddled dialogue. Off putting. Interesting issues raised. None resolved. Bizarre useless closeup shots. Good cast. Bad script. Promising first draft. Requires complete rewrite.

I understood this wasn't a blockbuster formula movie, but there's not a single likeable character in it. 

The actors were great with what they had to work with, but not even 1/4 the way into this film, I found myself wondering if it was a parody of academics or an attempt to test the audiences' patience. 
The plot could have worked if the film hadn't been so glibly treated by the filmmaker. 

Then there's the vomiting. 

What is up with Robert's character vomiting to a different musical score throughout the film? I wish I were kidding. 

For those opining that this film is "misunderstood" - well, duh! Who's fault is that!? 

Save yourself some time & nausea - and skip it.
Really great acting with a boring script and annoying use of a stopwatch.  Skip it. Garbage.

Not everything is supposed to make you comfortable.

After the Hunt is a 2025 psychological thriller film directed by Luca Guadagnino 🍿 

Not bad, but not my favourite either 😉
It’s ok, but I feel mixed about this one 😉
I’d recommend it if you like this genre, but if not then probably give it a miss 👍🏼👎🏼

A college professor finds herself at a personal and professional crossroads when a star pupil levels an accusation against one of her colleagues, and a dark secret from her own past threatens to come to light.
Plodding pace, pretentious plot. Colossal snoozeathon. It put me to sleep. Three times.

Many say it lacks of a plot which’s true but also on the artistic side of it, really is remarkable. I think something we focus to much on the meaning and the goal of a movie but we need more movie juste go for the feel of it. Strangely make me think of "A battle after a another one "
